description.h2: Element xbrli:xbrl must not have duplicate child xbrli:unit elements.
description.p: Element xbrli:xbrl must not have equivalent child xbrli:unit elements. Units are equivalent if they have equivalent measures or equivalent numerator and denominator. Measures are equivalent if their contents are equivalent QNames. Numerators and Denominators are equivalent if they have a set of equivalent measures.
REMARK: Some of these variations will be disallowed under 6.6.35 after a UTR is implemented.
REMARK: Abbreviations are from Base Units

variation.name: 6.5.12 No units the same - GOOD
variation.description: An instance having no duplicate units - GOOD

variation.name: 6.5.12 Same except Namespace Prefix - NOGOOD
variation.description: An instance having two units (kg) differing only in the namespace prefix on the measure QName (si: versus nist:).

variation.name: 6.5.12 Same except Order of Denominator - NOGOOD
variation.description: An instance having two units (Pascals) differing only in the order of their denominator elements (m*sec*sec vs sec*sec*m).

variation.name: 6.5.12 Same except Order of Numerator - NOGOOD
variation.description: An instance having two units (Newtons) differing only in the order of their numerator elements (m*kg vs kg*m).
